title: Puigdemont appears before Belgian authorities over arrest warrant
text:
Carles Puigdemont | Salvatore di Nolfi/EFE via EPA Puigdemont appears before Belgian authorities over arrest warrant Former Catalan leader handed himself over ‘voluntarily.’

Former Catalan leader Carles Puigdemont handed himself over to Belgian authorities on Friday morning, following the Spanish Supreme Court's decision to issue a new European arrest warrant against him.

Puigdemont fled to Belgium to avoid arrest after he declared Catalonia's independence in 2017 following a referendum that was ruled illegal.

"Puigdemont, accompanied by his lawyers, has appeared, voluntarily, before the Belgian authorities in response to the European arrest warrant issued by the Spanish Supreme Court," Puigdemont's Belgian lawyers said in a statement, the Guardian reported.

The statement adds that Puigdemont will comply with the warrant while remaining opposed to being extradited. He was not detained by police.

The new arrest warrant — for sedition and misuse of public funds — was expected to trigger fresh judicial proceedings in the Belgian courts, assuming Puigdemont remains in the country.

An earlier European arrest warrant against Puigdemont was withdrawn last December after a German court decided to extradite him to Spain on the charge of misuse of public funds but not for the more serious charge of rebellion. That would have meant Puigdemont facing lesser charges than his fellow separatists, some of whom were sentenced to up to 13 years in prison this week.

Demonstrations in Catalonia began hours after Monday's verdicts, with some 10,000 protesters swarming Barcelona's airport, causing more than 100 flights to be canceled. At least 130 people were injured. Demonstrators in Barcelona on Wednesday set up barricades, torched cars and launched projectiles at police.

Catalan unions called a general strike in the region for Friday.
description: Former Catalan leader handed himself over ‘voluntarily.’
